isis.stitle: 8 SPEED, 9 SPEED, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Attach a chain hoist to the auxiliary ( Figure 419). Move the assembly evenly into rear of the front case, piloting it on the dowel pins. As the assembly is moved forward, the countershaft drive gears will mesh with the auxiliary drive gear.

figure.caption: Figure 418. Move Assembly Evenly into Rear of Front Case

note.para: On 8-speed "LL" model auxiliary sections, shift the deep reduction sliding clutch into deep reduction before installing auxiliary. This will prevent possible timing error.

step1.para: Install the retaining bolts in the auxiliary housing flange and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm) ( Figure 420).

figure.caption: Figure 419. Install Retaining Bolts and Tighten

step1.para: The auxiliary section can also be installed with the transmission set in the vertical position ( Figure 421). Block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft, position the new gasket on the housing mounting surface and lower the assembly onto rear of the front case. Install the retaining bolts and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 Nm).

figure.caption: Figure 420. Auxiliary Section Can Be Installed With Transmission Set in Vertical Position

note.para: On 8-speed "LL" model auxiliary sections, shift the deep reduction sliding clutch into deep reduction before installing auxiliary. This will prevent possible timing error.
